meanings.definition: Relating to the making of maps or charts.
meanings.sent1: The cartographic skills of the explorer helped in creating detailed maps of the unknown lands.
meanings.sent2: The cartographic department at the university specializes in map-making techniques.
meanings.sent3: The cartographic artist drew a map of the neighborhood with exaggerated features for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cartographic wonder, mapping out every detail of the city she had never visited.
meanings.sent5: The cartographic precision of his drawings made it easy to navigate through the dense forest.

meanings.sent1: The cartographic tools used by the geographer were essential for accurate map creation.
meanings.sent2: Cartographic conventions dictate the symbols used to represent different features on a map.
meanings.sent3: The cartographic enthusiast had a globe collection that filled an entire room.
meanings.sent4: Her love for cartographic details was as deep as the ocean marked on the map.
meanings.sent5: The cartographic knowledge of the sailor guided the ship safely through unknown waters.

meanings.sent1: The cartographic project required extensive research into historical map-making techniques.
meanings.sent2: The cartographic analysis of the region revealed interesting patterns in population distribution.
meanings.sent3: The cartographic puzzle game challenged players to match maps with their corresponding legends.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts took a cartographic turn as she tried to navigate the complex social landscape.
meanings.sent5: The cartographic approach to problem-solving helped in visualizing the connections between different ideas.
